alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 11:28AM PST until January 29 at 11:39PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County. .Light rainfall tonight should not impact the Nooksack River but could delay the falling river levels on the Skokomish River. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Nooksack River at Ferndale. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, the river begins overtopping its banks within the City of Ferndale flooding low-lying areas within the City and low pasture lands along the river from near Ferndale downstream to the mouth. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM PST Monday the stage was 18.4 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM PST Monday was 18.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting now and is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling. Further rises are possible later this week. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 730 PM PST.
